subhead: 'We're going to run the country until such time as we can do a safe, proper and judicious transition,' Donald Trump said at a press conference following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro.

title: French managers of Swiss bar face criminal probe after fire
subhead: The two owners of Le Constellation bar, in the Swiss resort of Crans-Montana, said that they followed all safety norms.

title: Kyrylo Budanov, master spy and Zelensky's new right hand
subhead: A warrior at heart, the head of Ukrainian military intelligence has become, at 39, the president's chief of staff, at a diplomatically sensitive time for the country.

title: Behind Victor Wembanyama, the NBA's Frenchmen have mixed fortunes
subhead: Nineteen French players are currently competing in the NBA. While the San Antonio Spurs star commands most of the spotlight, the new generation is striving to find its place in an intensely competitive environment.

title: Dining at Claude Monet's table
subhead: 'A Meal at the Museum' (4/6). In Giverny, between Claude Monet's House and the Museum of Impressionism, Michelin-starred chef David Gallienne's new restaurant offers a tranquil haven where classic family cooking is given a fresh twist.

They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
subhead: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

title: Russia unleashes mass plunder of Ukrainian homes in occupied areas
subhead: A law signed by Vladimir Putin on December 15, 2025, encourages large-scale expropriation of property owners in areas occupied by the Russian army. Kyiv condemns the move as 'population replacement.'

title: How four years of war in Ukraine redefined the European Union
subhead: With Russia's aggression against Ukraine, the world that saw the construction of EU has all but disappeared. The 27 member states belatedly recognized that peace was 'no longer a given in Europe,' and awoke to their military weakness and energy dependence.
